source_sentence: 佛為勝光天子說王法經
translation: Sutra of the King Dharma Spoken for the Son of Vaiśravaṇa

source_sentence: 大唐沙門釋義淨奉　詔譯
translation: translated by imperial edict of the Great Tang ascetic Shi Yijingfeng

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時薄伽梵在室羅伐城逝多林給孤獨園，與大苾芻眾百千人俱，
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Bhagavān was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta’s Grove in Śrāvastī, accompanied by hundreds of thousands of great bhikṣus.

source_sentence: 皆是大阿羅漢，諸漏已盡。
translation: They are all great arhats whose contaminants have ended.

source_sentence: 復與無量菩薩摩訶薩俱，人中大龍，一生補處。
translation: He's also accompanied by measureless bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and great dragons among humans who will be reborn in one lifetime.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊在一樹下，於勝妙座加趺而坐，於大眾中，普為人、天演說自證微妙之法，
translation: At that time the World-honored One was seated cross-legged on a wonderful throne at the foot of a tree. In the midst of the great assembly, he expounded to all living beings and celestial beings the subtle

source_sentence: 所謂初、中、後善，文義巧妙，純一圓滿清淨鮮白梵行之相。
translation: It's called the first, middle, and last good, which are clever in words and meaning, purely one-pointed, perfect, pure, and pure, with the characteristic of pure religious practice.

source_sentence: 爾時，憍薩羅國王勝光天子，嚴駕侍從，出室羅伐，往逝多林，欲禮世尊，
translation: At that time the celestial being Supreme Light, king of Kośala, accompanied by his attendants, came out of Sāvatthī and went to Jeta’s Grove in order to venerate the World-honored One.

source_sentence: 恭敬供養，承事親近。
translation: They are honored and offered support, serve and become intimate with them.

source_sentence: 既至林所，下車整衣，詣大師處。
translation: When he arrived at the forest, he dismounted from his chariot and straightened his clothes to go to the place where the Master was staying.

source_sentence: 遙見如來坐於樹下為眾說法，顏貌端正，調伏諸根，意樂寂靜住增上定，
translation: From a distance he saw the World-honored One sitting at the foot of a tree, expounding the Dharma to the living beings. His countenance was dignified and his complexion well proportioned. He disciplined his senses and mental faculties

source_sentence: 人中龍象，如師子王，亦如牛王，如善智馬，人中最上，如白蓮華，如池湛寂，
translation: Among humans, nāgas and elephants are like lion kings, cattle kings, horses of good knowledge, the highest among human beings, like white lotus blossoms, calm as a pond.

source_sentence: 如妙高山安處大海，具三十二相、八十種好，如妙金幢形色充遍，亦如白日千光晃耀，
translation: Like the thirty-two secondary signs and eighty secondary signs of a great ocean, like the shape of a jeweled gold banner that fills all directions, like the white sun shining brightly with a thousand rays of light.

source_sentence: 如盛月輪，眾星圍遶。
translation: It's like the full moon wheel, surrounded by stars.

source_sentence: 時，王見已，生大歡喜，身毛遍竪，得未曾有。
translation: Seeing this sight, the king was greatly delighted. His body hair stood on end and his hair stood on end in such a sensation that it was unprecedented.

source_sentence: 灌頂大王有五盛事，所謂如意髻珠、白蓋、白拂、寶履、寶劍，悉皆棄捨，
translation: The great king of consecration had five grand rituals, namely, discarding the wish-granting pearl, the white canopy, the white whisk, the jeweled footstool, and the jeweled sword.

source_sentence: 著常人服，從以大臣，安詳正念，諸根寂靜，偏露右肩，整理衣服，曲躬合掌，
translation: He wore the clothes of ordinary people, followed the ways of ministers, and was peaceful and correctly mindful. His sense faculties were tranquil; he bared his right shoulder, arranged his clothes, and joined his palms with folded

source_sentence: 至世尊所，禮佛雙足，布上妙華，燒眾名香。
translation: When he arrived at the place where the World-honored One was, he bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet and greeted him. He spread a wonderful flower garland over the Buddha’s feet and burned various kinds of renowned incense

source_sentence: 為供養已，右繞三匝，退坐一面。
translation: After making these offerings, he circumambulated the Buddha three times to his right and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 時勝光王從座而起，如常威儀，合掌向佛作如是言：「惟願大師！
translation: King Vaiśravaṇa then rose from his seat, arose in his usual manner, joined his palms to the Buddha, and said, May it please you, Great Master!

source_sentence: 開悟於我，善教於我，為國主法，令於現在恒受安樂，命終之後當生天上，
translation: They will be enlightened by me and teach me well. As the ruler of my country, they will preach the Dharma so that I can always attain peace and happiness in this life. At the end of my life I will be reborn in heaven.

source_sentence: 乃至菩提善心相續。」
translation: It's the continuation of the good mind that leads to enlightenment.

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「善哉！
translation: The Buddha told the great king, Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Excellent, good!

source_sentence: 當一心聽，甚為希有！
translation: You should listen with one mind, how rare it is!

source_sentence: 孰能致問求勝資糧，當順法行，蠲除惡事。
translation: Who can ask questions and seek superior provisions, which should be practiced in accordance with the Dharma and remove bad things?

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 若王、大臣捨其善法行惡法者，於現世中人所輕鄙，不敢親附咸生疑惑，
translation: If kings and ministers abandon their good qualities and practice bad qualities, they'll be despised by people in the present world and won't dare to associate with them, and all will become doubtful.

source_sentence: 常見惡夢多有怨家，後生懊悔，命終之後墮地獄中。
translation: They often have bad dreams in which there are many enemies, and later they become remorseful and fall into hell after their lives end.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 若王、大臣遠離惡法修善法者，於現世中人所欣仰，皆來親附不生疑惑，
translation: If kings and senior ministers abstain from bad states and cultivate good states, they will be delighted by the people of the present life. They will all come to associate with them and not give rise to doubt or confusion.

source_sentence: 常見好夢能除怨敵，無復追悔，命終之後得生天上，乃至菩提證真常樂。
translation: They often see good dreams that can remove enemies and no longer chase after them, and when their lives end, they'll be born in heaven or even attain enlightenment and realize true eternal bliss.

source_sentence: 「大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 譬如父母，憐愛諸子，常願安隱，令無惱害，遮其惡行，勸修善業。
translation: It's like a father and mother who have pity for their children and always wish to be peaceful, so that they won't harm them, shield them from bad actions, and encourage good actions.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 為天子者亦復如是，於諸臣佐乃至國人僕使之類，咸以四攝而恩育之，
translation: So it is with the prince of gods, who are likewise nurtured by their ministers, assistants, officials, servants, messengers, and so forth, all through the four means of salvation.

source_sentence: 布施、愛語、利行、同事。
translation: Giving, loving words, beneficial actions, and co-workers.

source_sentence: 時彼人王能於國界，廣作如是大饒益已，成就二種利益之事。
translation: That person king then was able to accomplish two kinds of benefits for the kingdom's borders after he had done so greatly benefiting them.

source_sentence: 云何為二？
translation: What are these two?

source_sentence: 王如父母，愛念無差；
translation: The king, like his parents, had no difference in affection for them.

source_sentence: 國人如子，並懷忠孝。
translation: The people of the country are like children, all cherishing loyalty and filial piety.

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 作天子者，情懷恩恕，薄為賦斂，省其傜役；
translation: Being a celestial prince, he cherished kindness and forgiveness in his heart. He was poorly disciplined and exempted from the punishment of torture.

source_sentence: 設官分職，不務繁多；
translation: Their officials are divided into different grades and do not have many duties.

source_sentence: 黜罰惡人，賞進賢善；
translation: He deposed the evil and rewarded the virtuous.

source_sentence: 不忠良者，當速遠離；
translation: Those who are disloyal and good should quickly leave.

source_sentence: 順古聖王，勿行刑戮。
translation: O ancient sage king, do not torture and slaughter people.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 生人道者，勝緣所感，若斷其命，定招惡報。
translation: A person born in the human path is subject to a superior condition, and if they cut off their life, it will surely bring bad retribution.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 常當一心恭敬三寶，莫生邪見。
translation: They should always whole-heartedly venerate the Three Treasures and not give rise to wrong views.

source_sentence: 我涅槃後，法付國王，大臣、輔相，當為擁護，勿致衰損；
translation: After my nirvalJa, the dharma will be entrusted to the king. His ministers and senior officials should protect it so that it does not decline.

source_sentence: 然正法炬，轉正法輪，盡未來際常令不絕。
translation: Still, the torch of the right teaching turns the wheel of the right teaching, and it always remains unceasing throughout the future.

source_sentence: 若能如是依教行者，則令國中龍王歡喜，風調雨順，諸天慶悅，豐樂安隱，
translation: If one can follow the teaching and practice in this way, they will cause the dragon kings of the land to rejoice. The wind and rain will be gentle and the heavenly gods will be happy and prosperous and at ease.

source_sentence: 災橫皆除，率土太平，王身快樂，永保勝位，福力延長，無復憂惱，增益壽命，
translation: The calamities will all be eliminated, the whole land will be peaceful and the king’s body blissful. He will always retain his pre-eminent position of sovereignty. His power of blessedness will increase, so that he

source_sentence: 現在名稱遍滿十方。
translation: The present name pervades the ten directions.

source_sentence: 外國諸王咸共讚歎：『某國天子仁讓忠孝，以法教化，拯恤黔黎，於諸國中最為第一。
translation: The kings of the foreign countries all praised him, saying, 'Some country has a deity who's benevolent and loyal, teaches and saves Qiali with the Dharma, and is the best among nations.

source_sentence: 我等今者，咸當歸伏此大法王，捨身之後得生天上，受勝妙樂，乃至菩提！』
translation: Now, we will all subdue this great king of the Dharma and be born in heaven after abandoning our bodies, where we'll experience superior bliss and even attain enlightenment!'

source_sentence: 「復次大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 一切諸法體性空虛，無常滅壞。
translation: The essence of all dharmas is empty and void, impermanent, ceasing and decaying.

source_sentence: 譬如有人，於夜夢中，見好園圃，山河人眾，茂林清泉，堂舍樓閣皆可愛樂，
translation: Suppose there is a man in a dream at night who sees beautiful parks, rivers, forests, clear streams, and luxuriant fountains. All the houses and buildings are pleasing to him.

source_sentence: 及其睡覺，一無所見。
translation: When he woke up, he saw nothing at all.

source_sentence: 大王當知！
translation: Great king, you should know!

source_sentence: 所紹王位及以壽命，諸有勝樂，自在尊貴，五欲歡娛，象馬車步、父母兄弟、男女妃后、所有國人乃至臣妾，
translation: The king’s throne and the length of his life span will be determined by various kinds of superior happiness, such as sovereignty, arrogance, enjoyment of the five desires, elephants, horses, chariots, footstep

source_sentence: 金銀珍寶、衣服飲食及諸庫藏，命終之際悉皆棄捨。
translation: The treasures of gold, silver, jewelry, clothing, food, and storehouses were all discarded at the end of his life.

source_sentence: 此等眾事，皆是無常滅壞之法，事難保守，體是動搖，終歸離散；
translation: These things are all impermanent, dharmas that perish and perish; they are difficult to preserve. Their essence is movement, but ultimately they belong to dispersal.

source_sentence: 可怖畏處，能生苦惱，無我、我所，亦無主宰。
translation: A place of fearfulness can cause suffering and distress, which has no self or what belongs to self and no owner.

source_sentence: 常應觀察，勿為放逸。
translation: You should always observe it and not be careless.

source_sentence: 「復次，大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 譬如大樹，初生葉華，次當結實，果既熟已，漸當墮落；
translation: It is like the case of a great tree whose leaves and flowers will first grow, and then they will bear fruit. When the fruit has matured, it will gradually fall down.

source_sentence: 青葉次黃，後悉零墜，終至皆盡，唯有空樹。
translation: The leaves of the cyan trees grew yellow in succession, all falling down gradually. When they reach the ground everything is exhausted but the sky-covered tree remains.

source_sentence: 其樹乾枯，有大火至，熾然猛焰，不久燒盡。
translation: The trees withered, and a great fire broke out. Burning brightly and blazing hotly, it soon burned up completely.

source_sentence: 「復次，大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 譬如日月，有大威力，具大光明，能令黑闇悉皆除盡，此亦不久終歸磨滅。
translation: It's like the sun and moon, which have great power and are endowed with great radiance that can remove all darkness and blackness, but it won't be long before this returns to decay.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 如是當觀無常、無我滅壞之事，應生怖懼。
translation: Thus, you should observe impermanent and selfless things that cease and disintegrate, and you should become frightened.

source_sentence: 而作國王當以法化，勿行非法，常修眾善，不隨惡行。
translation: Instead, the king should be a king who teaches people according to the Dharma and not practice what's against the Dharma, always cultivates goodness and doesn't follow bad actions.

source_sentence: 「復次，大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 譬如四面各有大山，從四方來，堅固一段，無有空缺，上陵大虛，下磨地界，
translation: It is as if there were a great mountain on each of the four sides, which came from each of the four directions and was as firm as any section of the ground. There was no space between the peaks above it and the great space beneath it; but below that

source_sentence: 於中所有草木、叢林及諸生類，無一飛走能得免者，無有壯夫而為拒敵，
translation: In all the grass, trees, shrubs, forests, and other living creatures there was not a single flying bird that could escape. There was no strong man to oppose it.

source_sentence: 亦無能以呪、藥、財物可令迴去。
translation: Nor can he cause them to turn away with a spell, medicine, or possessions.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 人間四山亦復如是，謂老、病、死及以失勢。
translation: The four mountains of the human world are likewise: old age, sickness, death and loss of power.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 老若來時，令人衰悴；
translation: When old age comes, it will cause them to become emaciated.

source_sentence: 疾病若至，能生苦惱；
translation: When sickness occurs, it can cause suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 死期現前，必當命斷；
translation: Their deaths will surely come before them, and their lives will surely end.

source_sentence: 勢若失時，滅其威力。
translation: When their momentum is lost, they'll cease their authority.

source_sentence: 「復次，大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 如師子王，駿疾多力，爪牙鋒利，入鹿群中，隨意取食，無能為礙，此諸獸類被他所愶，
translation: Good man, this is analogous to the case of a lion king who suffers from an ailment. With strong claws and sharp fangs he enters among the herds of deer and feeds as he wishes without being prevented by any hindrance

source_sentence: 無有自在。
translation: There's no self-dependence.

source_sentence: 大王當知！
translation: Great king, you should know!

source_sentence: 一切眾生被死箭射，無有豪強，無歸無護；
translation: All sentient beings are shot by the arrow of death, without power or strength, without refuge or protection.

source_sentence: 命欲斷時，骨節離解，血肉乾燥，口不能言，手足撩亂，勢力都盡；
translation: When his life was about to be cut off, the bones and joints were dismembered. His flesh and blood dried up; his mouth could not speak, and his hands and feet trembled in distress, exhausting their power.

source_sentence: 涎唾、便利遍污其身，眼等六根悉皆閉塞，喉中氣逆，飲食不通；
translation: They stained their bodies with saliva, spittle, and excretion. Their eyes, etc., were all shut off from the six sense faculties; the air in their throats smelled bad and they could not eat or drink.

source_sentence: 念念之間後識將盡，無始時來生老病死，苦海流轉隨業而去；
translation: Between one thought and the next, as consciousness is about to perish, birth, old age, sickness, and death come from beginningless time. The sea of suffering flows in and leaves according to action.

source_sentence: 即於此時命根將斷，隨所作業皆悉現前，琰摩使人甚可怖畏，黑闇長夜無能違逆；
translation: At that moment the vital faculty was about to be cut off, and whatever he did would appear before him. The great fearsome demon Diem became so terrifying that no one could resist it even for a long time in the darkness of darkness.

source_sentence: 出入之息溘然而盡，獨行無侶，所向慞惶。
translation: Their breaths of coming and going ceaselessly, and they travel alone without companions. All the directions are panicstricken in fear.

source_sentence: 捨此人間，趣於後世，將墜大坑，入深闇處；
translation: They will leave this world and go to the afterlife. They are about to fall into a great pit and enter a deep dark place.

source_sentence: 惟涉險道，無復資糧；
translation: They traveled on dangerous paths and had no provisions.

source_sentence: 業風所吹，不知前路，爾時厄難無別歸依，於此時中隨業受報。
translation: When the wind of karma blows and they don't know their path, there's no separate refuge for those in distress at that point, and the results are received according to their actions at that point.

source_sentence: 「大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 有陀羅尼，名曰勝幡。
translation: There's a dhāraṇī named the superior banner.

source_sentence: 若人先時曾受持者，於生死中能為善伴，共相救護。
translation: If someone had previously received and maintained it, they'll be able to be a good companion in birth-and-death and rescue each other.

source_sentence: 大王善聽！
translation: Great king, listen well!

source_sentence: 我今為說。
translation: Now, I'll explain it for you.

source_sentence: 呪曰：「南謨釋迦牟奈曳　怛他揭多也　阿羅喝帝三藐三勃陀也　怛姪他唵　苫謎苫謎　薩婆波跛　鉢羅苫末泥(去)莎訶」佛告大王：「此陀羅尼諸佛所說，
translation: The dhāraṇī said, South is Śākyamuni the Buddha who teaches this dhāraṇī to the great king, saying,

source_sentence: 於日日中清淨澡漱，常誦七遍，有大威神能為救濟——如遭極寒，遇炎火聚；
translation: Every day he washes and rinses himself thoroughly, chanting it seven times a day. He possesses great supernatural powers and is able to rescue those who are in distress, as if they were confronted by a mass of hot fire in the

source_sentence: 如大熱時，得清冷水；
translation: It is like the acquisition of cool water at the time of great heat:

source_sentence: 盛夏尋路，逢好樹陰；
translation: In the height of summer he traveled in search of a path and came across a shade of good trees.

source_sentence: 如渴，遇清泉；
translation: It is as if one were thirsty and came across a clear spring.

source_sentence: 如飢，得美食；
translation: It is like a hungry man who obtains delicious food.

source_sentence: 如病，蒙呪藥，又復遇良醫；
translation: Suppose there is a sick person who receives a magical medicine and also meets a good physician.

source_sentence: 如怯怖人，得強壯伴。
translation: It's like a frightened person who has a strong companion.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 如是有福之人臨欲死時，有好瑞相，而為導引。
translation: Thus, when a blessed person is about to die and wants to die, there are good omens that guide them.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 於此時中唯有善法，共相護念，為作歸依，惟此陀羅尼善能救濟。
translation: At the time, there's only a good dharma that protects each other and serves as a refuge for them, but this dhāraṇī can skillfully rescue them.

source_sentence: 是故大王！
translation: Therefore, great king!

source_sentence: 常當日日誦此神呪，能得消除一切罪障，復能生長無量福因，當善觀察，
translation: You should always recite this dhāraṇī day after day, so that you will be able to remove all your sins and hindrances. It will also produce immeasurable causes of merit. Observe them closely.

source_sentence: 無常滅壞究竟空無，於死門中生大恐怖，以善化世莫行惡法，常修福業起大慈悲。
translation: When impermanence ceases and disintegrates, ultimately emptiness is nonexistent, great fear arises in the gate of death, transforms the world with goodness, doesn't practice bad qualities, always cultivates meritorious actions, and produces great

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 然於此身常所愛護，供以名厨上妙飲食，隨時偃息，無憂自在。
translation: However, he always loves and protects this body as an offering of food and drink called a cooked meal. He stops eating at any time without worries and has no self-dependence.

source_sentence: 雖受如是殊勝之樂，終歸不免臨死之際飢火來逼，乏食而死。
translation: Even though they experience such extraordinary bliss, they ultimately return and can't escape being confronted with hunger and fire at the time of their death, and die because they lack food.

source_sentence: 「復次，大王！
translation: Furthermore, great king!

source_sentence: 所著衣服皆是微妙——迦尸、白疊、錦綺、綾羅、涼燠。
translation: The clothes he wears are all subtle - kaśi, white cotton, brocaded, draped, and cool.

source_sentence: 順時任情受樂，終歸不免臨死之際委臥床席，迴轉隨人，垢膩縈身，衾裳霑體，
translation: At the time of his death he was lying on a bed or seat and following others around. His body was tethered by dirt and grease; his hair stood on end, his clothes stood on end, and his body was covered with abscesses.

source_sentence: 能令見者生可惡心。
